title: Patient Decision Making
description: The patient's cognitive journey: processing clinical information through personal values, social context, and lived experience toward informed preference.

main.label: Input
main.description: Central hub receiving all information relevant to patient's decision

processor.label: Data Processor
processor.description: Personal context, capacity, and individual factors shaping information processing

knowledge.label: Decision Competence
knowledge.description: Cognitive capacity and ability to make independent decisions

knowledge.label: Affect and Bodily
knowledge.description: Emotional state, physical symptoms, and embodied experience

knowledge.label: Values, Social Identity
knowledge.description: Personal values, cultural identity, and social expectations

knowledge.label: Previous Healthcare
knowledge.description: Past encounters with the healthcare system and illness

knowledge.label: Social & Economic
knowledge.description: Family support, financial resources, social network

knowledge.label: Health Literacy
knowledge.description: Ability to understand and use health information

hypothesis.label: Hypothesis
hypothesis.description: Initial understanding and emerging preference - the central concept mediating patient's cognitive processing

system1.label: System I
system1.description: Gut feeling, emotional response, instinctive reaction to information

system2.label: System II
system2.description: Careful consideration of options, weighing pros and cons, deliberate reasoning

reflection.label: Reflection
reflection.description: Personal value alignment and preference crystallization - bidirectional exchange between intuitive and analytical processing

planning.label: Finalized Preference
planning.description: Communicated decision when patient reaches clarity
items: Communicating the decision with the care provider

collection.label: Information Seeking
collection.description: Request additional information when uncertainty remains
collection.loopback: Returns to Input - new information updates understanding

refinement.description: Continuous iterative loop on the side

communication.label: Communicating the decision with the care provider
communication.description: Final step where patient preference is shared with the clinical team

flowDescription.overview: Information flows from Inputs through the Data Processor to form a Hypothesis (initial understanding/preference). The Hypothesis mediates bidirectional exchange between three processor engines: Data Processor, System I (Intuition), and System II (Analytical). System I and II engage in Reflection (bidirectional evaluation). This cycle may iterate 2-4 times.
flowDescription.decisionPoint: At Reflection, the preference is either: (1) CRYSTALLIZED → proceeds to Finalized Preference, (2) NEEDS REVISION → loops back to Data Processor, or (3) NEEDS MORE INFO → proceeds to Information Seeking which returns new data to Input.
flowDescription.patientSpecific: Unlike clinician decision-making, patient processing is heavily influenced by values, social identity, emotional states, and health literacy. The output is a preference rather than a clinical action plan.
